column5: The ramp at old cut in Long Point bay is open and there was a boat in the channels on Wednesday.¬† I can't imagine that he went out on the bay in the wind.. it may be a busy place this weekend..

The smaller tribs have perfect colour right now...

I‚Äôm going to be on the ice tomorrow, whether it‚Äôs briefly or I actually fish time will tell lol. Let‚Äôs hope the briefly doesn‚Äôt end by surprise. I do gotta laugh‚Ä¶we almost had a perfect set up with a couple of cold nights lined up to tighten things up a bit‚Ä¶nah forget that if that‚Äôs going to happen, better get a quick insulating dumping of snow in just as the thermometer hits 0 again‚Ä¶we can‚Äôt win this year I tell ya.

My bay at 7th line of Innisfil, is finally decent, me and my boy went this past Monday, man it was super windy. The wind ripped out a peg for the pop out and popped the side into us lol. But we managed to catch a feed of Perch. Looks like we might have a bit of a season, getting colder again.

I know im long long longggg overdue for a report, but planning a wedding, renovating a house, work and of course fishing get in the way. Welcome to the thread where you can complain about the ice conditions on your local water hole. This fish may be one of only a handful of laketrout caught through a hole in the ice on the great lakes this year. You would think -31 degree temperatures would freeze water, instead we managed to lose ice this past weekend due to the intense wind, breaking up about 300 yards of ice, while also flooding the ice that I was fishing on with 6+inches of water. All i can say is, thank god for my (now defunct) Kast steelhead gloves that allowed for me to pull my tent's pegs out of the ice while they were under 4 inches of water in -22 with dry warm hands. The walk home through that knee deep snow and water was absolute hell, the slush instantly freezing to the bottom of my sled making a 300 meter walk back to the truck taking over half an hour. I actually started laughing maniacly at one point while trying to pack up my already busted up tent, the broken pole within managed to twist itself inside of another set of poles making it effectively impossible to fold away entirely without entirely re-deploying the tent, which was now impossible due to the 60kmh winds and water on the ice. I gave up, folded it best as i could into a pile on the sled and strapped it down. I found ice that ranged in depth from 8 inches to 2 50 meters apart from one spot to the next...at this rate we will be boating in no time.

Too funny with the tent. ¬†I went through the same thing Saturday. ¬†Wife holding onto the tent while I did my best to break it down. ¬†Ya we didn‚Äôt talk much until we got back to the truck lol. ¬†Luckily nothing broke. ¬†Thanks for the report.

Yeah...the ice conditions definitely suck this year. On the other hand, the glass is half full. The mild temps and liquid precip have kept the tribs open, and the migratories coming in at a steady pace. Much prefer to play with chrome on 13 ft of graphite rather than a 2 ft stick through a hole. Trout can't do cartwheels through the ice. Best winter Steelheading in 20 years.
Seem fine this morning,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, Walked out late, had a meeting,pass 3 guys,drill and well,OOPS there it is.

It wasn't too fine for somebody last night...not even sure what he was doing out there...he heard some cracking so he panicked ?? https://www.orilliamatters.com/police-beat/drone-hovercraft-used-to-rescue-man-from-lake-simcoe-ice-6507876
There has been many warnings about the ice at Johnson beach. You can be on 7" and walk 10 ft away and be on 2".¬† Been there.
Unreal catches

Something isn‚Äôt adding up on this one what the heck!  misfish same story here, we got set up I ripped my bait a few times, suddenly a mark showed up on the livescope in 20 fow (I was fishing 50) 25 feet to the side, I reel up to 20 rip my bait twice boom the mark storms to my bait in a flash and I‚Äôm on.

"Something isn‚Äôt adding up on this one what the heck!" I get the impression that this dude had some mushrooms for dessert... went for an after-dinner walk and followed the white carpet in to the bay.

"Welcome to the thread where you can complain about the ice conditions on your local water hole" OK.. I'm at the cottage this week hoping to get a few Whitefish, Crappie or Walleye for dinner. As of today, there's about 6 inches of standing water on the lake. Glass is definitely half empty here...lol Think I'll go back to chasing Chrome in the creek.

By the title of the thread I was thinking this was going to be about ice fishing for crappies.............üôÑ South of CrowMan down around Kingston, the ice is getting pretty sketchy.¬† It is supposed to go down a bit tonight and be below zero in the morning, but...but...but...I am not in a real hurry to see if my floater suit works or not. Shortest ice season I can recall. Doug

Pretty sad... My bay on the 7th line on Simcoe wasn't good until last weekend and now its super unsafe and getting worse. The next 10 day forecast doesn't look promising at all. Come on open water then!
Yep, that is the light at the end of the tunnel for sure. Doug
There's been a bunch of later seasons in the past decade were we don't get ice until far after new years and it stays longer, but I just can't see that this year, unless it's 0 degrees in April lol

Bring on the open water.¬† Can't wait to dip the boat into Parry Sound in a couple of weeks.

First part of his headline is from years ago, the part about the one inch opening right through his hut also he can‚Äôt decide if he is part of the metric world or imperial world he just too things he read on social media and made a story out of them
But isn't that typical Canadiana? We all buy gas by the litre for boats we measure in feet, and describe distance by how long it takes to get there. It's almost a requirement for citizenship.

I checked the forecast earlier today. Looks like winters over. ¬†Another year and no ice fishing for me. I can‚Äôt remember the last time. ¬†Must be eight years ago. ¬†I still have fun I just do other things.
https://www.cbsnews.com/news/three-men-die-falling-through-ice-vermont-fishing-tournament-canceled-warm-weather/

We ain‚Äôt fixing climate change any time soon. it‚Äôs February 15th the literal cold dead heart of the middle of winter it‚Äôs 10 degrees outside and pouring rain. i saw a map from a US storm chaser yesterday, there is a heightened risk of tornados today through tornado alley reaching into the Niagara region‚Ä¶in February. just another ‚Äúonce in a lifetime warm weather event‚Äù that seemingly happens every year these days. It‚Äôs actually incredible how bad it‚Äôs getting right before our eyes. We used to get a thaw in the winter sometimes even two, a warm day here and there, I can never recall where 7 to 10 degrees above 0 for weeks on end was the dominant weather pattern in winter. a guy on my parents road said ‚ÄúI‚Äôve lived here 40 years I‚Äôve never seen this bay not freeze‚Äù when we asked about ice conditions the first year we moved to the new place, 3/4 of the bay froze, the rest is wide open water.
